title: The Meridian Manor Incident
setting: A prestigious dinner party at Meridian Manor has ended in tragedy. A prominent figure has been found dead in the bedroom, and every guest is a suspect. The police have sealed the manor — no one leaves until the truth is uncovered.
briefing: A prominent figure has been found dead at Meridian Manor. Nine suspects. Five rooms. Eleven clues. No one can be trusted — not even the game itself.
epilogue: The broken perfume bottle was no perfume at all — it was the delivery vessel for the poison. The insurance documents and crumpled threat note sealed Victor's fate. Witnesses saw him leave the study at 8 PM and return smelling of chemicals. The case is closed.

rooms.name: The Bedroom
rooms.narrative_label: the Bedroom, during the dinner party
rooms.description: The crime scene. A lavish master bedroom now draped in an unsettling stillness. The body has been removed, but the faint scent of something chemical lingers in the air. Silk curtains frame a window overlooking the garden.

clues.name: Broken Perfume Bottle
clues.description: Shattered glass on the nightstand. The liquid smells chemical, not floral — this isn't perfume.

clues.name: Smudged Fingerprints
clues.description: Multiple sets of smudged fingerprints on the door handle. Impossible to identify any single person.

clues.name: Torn Business Letter
clues.description: A partially torn letter mentioning a hostile takeover. The signature is missing.

rooms.name: The Kitchen
rooms.narrative_label: the Kitchen, away from the guests
rooms.description: A professional-grade kitchen still warm from the evening's dinner service. Copper pots hang from a ceiling rack. The dessert course sits half-prepared on the marble counter.

clues.name: Wine Glass with Residue
clues.description: One wine glass wasn't properly washed. A faint discoloration stains the inside — could be nothing, could be something.

clues.name: Missing Chef's Knife
clues.description: A gap in the magnetic knife rack. Elena insists she had a full set before tonight. But the murder wasn't by knife...

rooms.name: The Study
rooms.description: Dark wood paneling and leather chairs. A mahogany desk is buried under stacks of legal documents and financial reports. The air smells of old paper and expensive whiskey.

clues.name: Insurance Documents
clues.description: Victor's briefcase lies open. Inside: insurance documents with a suspiciously large payout clause, recently amended.

clues.name: Crumpled Note
clues.description: A handwritten note, crumpled and tossed near the wastebin: "We need to talk about what you did. Tonight." Unsigned.

rooms.name: The Lounge
rooms.description: An elegant sitting room with velvet sofas and a crackling fireplace. A half-finished chess game sits on a side table. The phone sits on its cradle — recently used.

clues.name: Phone Records
clues.description: Dr. Webb's call log is on the table. It shows a 2-minute call at 7:45 PM — not the 'hour-long call' he claims.

clues.name: Empty Medicine Bottle
clues.description: A prescription bottle with the victim's name. Recently emptied. The label reads a common heart medication.

rooms.name: The Garden
rooms.description: A moonlit garden with manicured hedges and a stone path winding between rose bushes. The kitchen door and study window both open onto this space. Fresh mud near the bedroom window.

clues.name: Muddy Footprints
clues.description: A trail of muddy footprints leading from the kitchen door around to the bedroom window. Someone was outside recently.

clues.name: Camera with Photos
clues.description: Ren's camera. The timestamps on his garden photos show the garden was empty at 8 PM — contradicting Thomas's claim that he was there all evening.

suspects.name: Victor Ashford
suspects.motive: A hostile takeover gone wrong. Victor stood to gain from a massive insurance payout, and the victim was about to expose the scheme.

dialogue.default: I was reviewing documents all evening. This is a tragedy — we had so many plans together.

clue_triggered.insurance_docs: Those documents are routine business. Every partner has them. You're grasping at straws.
clue_triggered.crumpled_note: ...Where did you find that? It's not what it looks like. Business partners have disagreements.
clue_triggered.torn_letter: That letter is about a completely separate matter. Corporate restructuring. Nothing sinister.

confrontation.perfume_bottle+insurance_docs: You don't understand the pressure I was under. He was going to ruin everything. Everything I built. I had no choice.

dialogue.default: I was preparing the dessert course all evening. Crème brûlée — it requires constant attention. I never left this kitchen.

clue_triggered.missing_knife: That knife! I know I had the full set when I started. Someone must have taken it. But who would... no, I'm sure it'll turn up.
clue_triggered.wine_glass: I washed all the glasses myself. If one wasn't clean, it must have been used after I finished.

dialogue.default: I was on a long phone call in the lounge. Medical consultation — you know how these things go. Very involved.

clue_triggered.phone_records: ...Two minutes? That can't be right. Well, perhaps I... I may have exaggerated slightly. I stepped out briefly.
clue_triggered.medicine_bottle: That's the victim's heart medication. I prescribed it myself. It's perfectly routine — nothing unusual about it.

confrontation.phone_records+medicine_bottle: Fine. My call was short. I stepped out for air and... I saw Victor coming from the bedroom corridor. I didn't think much of it at the time. I wish I had.

dialogue.default: I found him. I went to check on him and he was... I can't. I just can't talk about it. He was already cold.

clue_triggered.perfume_bottle: That's not his scent. He never wore anything like that. Someone brought this here — it's not from this room.
clue_triggered.smudged_fingerprints: Everyone came in after I screamed. The fingerprints could be anyone's.

dialogue.default: I was tending the garden all evening. Pruning the roses — they need attention this time of year. I didn't see anything unusual.

clue_triggered.camera_photos: ...The garden was empty? I... I may have stepped away briefly. For a smoke. I'm not supposed to smoke on the grounds.
clue_triggered.muddy_footprints: Those are my boots, yes. I walk around the whole property every evening. That's my job.

confrontation.camera_photos+muddy_footprints: Alright, fine! I was sneaking a cigarette by the bedroom window. The Madam doesn't allow smoking. I didn't see anything, I swear.

dialogue.default: I was helping Elena in the kitchen. She can confirm — I was right here the whole time. We were discussing the household accounts between courses.

clue_triggered.insurance_docs: I handle the household finances, not the business side. Victor manages his own affairs. But those payout numbers do seem... unusually high.

dialogue.default: Victor and I were reviewing contracts in the study. Standard quarterly review. Nothing out of the ordinary.

clue_triggered.insurance_docs: Victor was nervous all evening, truth be told. He kept checking his watch. At one point he stepped out for 'fresh air.' He was gone for maybe fifteen minutes.
clue_triggered.crumpled_note: I didn't write that note, if that's what you're implying. But Victor received it earlier. I saw him read it and... he went pale.

confrontation.insurance_docs+crumpled_note: Look, I'm Victor's lawyer, but I'm not going to obstruct an investigation. He was agitated all night. He left the study around 8 PM and came back smelling of something chemical. I assumed it was the garden.

dialogue.default: My brother... I can't believe he's gone. We were just talking about the estate yesterday. He seemed fine. Happy, even.

clue_triggered.medicine_bottle: He was on heart medication, yes. Marcus prescribed it. But he was getting better — at least that's what Marcus told us.
clue_triggered.torn_letter: A hostile takeover? My brother never mentioned any business troubles. Victor handled all of that.

dialogue.default: I was photographing the garden at dusk. The light was incredible — golden hour lasts forever here. I have the photos to prove it.

clue_triggered.camera_photos: Yes, look at the timestamps. The garden was empty at 8 PM. Thomas claims he was there, but my camera doesn't lie.
clue_triggered.muddy_footprints: I noticed those too. They go from the kitchen door around to the bedroom window. That's not the path to the roses.

weapons.narrative_label: a poison vial disguised as a perfume bottle

weapons.narrative_label: a kitchen knife from the chef's set
